content:
Add an Image to a FlexCard

To add an image to a FlexCard in the FlexCard Designer:

Drag an Image element from the Build panel into a state on the canvas.

Update the element name in the Element Name field, if desired.

Select the Image Source from one of these options:
* Enter the absolute URL of the image.
* Click the search icon and click Upload Files to upload a file from your computer.
* Click the search icon and select an image from the Select an Image from Content Document dropdown to use a file from a library in Salesforce.
* Enter /resource/resourceName to use a file uploaded as a static resource.

Select an option from the Size dropdown to adjust the size of the image relative to the canvas size, if desired.

On the canvas, adjust the element size to fit your image as needed.

Enter text describing the image in the Alternative Text field for accessibility.

Enter a Newport, SLDS, or custom CSS class in the Extra Class field, if desired.

Enter text in the Title field to display an image caption, and style it by entering a class in the Title Class field.

To launch an action on click of the element, see Add a Click Event to a FlexCard Element. To add conditions that must be met for the element to display, see Add Conditions to a FlexCard Element.

Style your element by clicking Style to open the Style panel and see Style FlexCard Elements.

Preview your FlexCard by seeing Preview a FlexCard.
title: Adding Images to FlexCards
